name: Tributary Inflow Condition
functionStatement: Quantity + quality of inflow (tributaries, ditches, and pipes) does not provide harmful peaks or pollution, and supports diverse habitat conditions.
descriptionMarkdown: Tributaries stable, matching reference (flow, quality, form), with no major flash/pollution surges.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed and Channel

Method: Field
howToMeasureMarkdown: At confluences, visually assess flow stability and turbidity. Supplement with available impairment lists and local monitoring data.

inputs.label: Tributary Inflow Condition
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Tributaries are mostly natural with stable flows and sediment loads consistent with reference conditions. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 1-2 tributaries are moderately altered or somewhat polluted. (Suggested index range 0.50-0.69)

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Multiple tributaries are significantly altered and deliver high sediment or pollutants. (Suggested index range 0.30-0.49)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Widespread severe tributary impacts that overwhelm the mainstem. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: Field observations with turbidity tube or meter

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

bin1.name: Poor
bin1.desc: Widespread severe tributary impacts that overwhelm the mainstem.

bin2.name: Fair
bin2.desc: 1-2 tributaries are moderately altered or somewhat polluted. / Multiple tributaries are significantly altered and deliver high sediment or pollutants.

bin3.name: Good
bin3.desc: Tributaries are mostly natural with stable flows and sediment loads consistent with reference conditions.
